obstetrics.Preeclampsia:
SITUATION: 39-year-old G2P1 at 34+2 weeks with severe preeclampsia

BACKGROUND: Normotensive throughout pregnancy until 32 weeks. Presented to triage with severe headache, visual disturbances, and epigastric pain. No previous history of hypertension. Family history of preeclampsia (mother).

ASSESSMENT: BP 165/110 mmHg, significant proteinuria (3+ on dipstick), hyperreflexia present. Bloods show: Hb 12.1, platelets 145, ALT 68, creatinine 89. CTG reactive with baseline 145 bpm.

RECOMMENDATION: Admit to delivery suite. Antihypertensive therapy commenced (labetalol 200mg BD). Magnesium sulfate for seizure prophylaxis. Steroids for fetal lung maturity. Urgent consultant review for delivery planning.
obstetrics.Gestational diabetes:
SITUATION: 36-year-old G3P1 at 28+0 weeks with newly diagnosed gestational diabetes mellitus

BACKGROUND: Routine OGTT performed due to BMI >30 and family history of diabetes. Fasting glucose 5.8, 2-hour 9.2 mmol/L. Previous baby weighed 4.1kg. Currently asymptomatic.

ASSESSMENT: Patient well, observations stable. Fundal height appropriate for dates. No glycosuria on current sample. Home glucose monitoring commenced showing readings 4.2-7.8 mmol/L.

RECOMMENDATION: Diabetic team referral arranged. Dietary counselling provided. Self-monitoring of blood glucose QDS. Growth scans every 4 weeks. Consider insulin if dietary control inadequate.
obstetrics.Preterm labor:
SITUATION: 22-year-old G1P0 presenting with acute onset preterm labor

BACKGROUND: Patient has a background of [relevant medical history]. Current pregnancy/cycle has been uncomplicated until now. No known drug allergies. Regular medications include folic acid 5mg daily. Family history significant for maternal diabetes and hypertension.

ASSESSMENT: On examination: BP 140/90, HR 88, temp 37.2°C. Abdomen soft, fundal height appropriate. CTG shows baseline 140 with good variability. Urinalysis shows trace protein. Bloods pending including FBC, U&Es, LFTs, and coagulation studies.

RECOMMENDATION: Plan: Admit for monitoring and further investigation. IV access established. Continuous CTG monitoring. Serial BP measurements. Consultant review within 2 hours. Consider delivery if condition deteriorates.

ADDITIONAL NOTES:
- Patient counselled regarding condition and management options
- Written information provided
- Next of kin contacted and updated
- Documentation completed in patient notes
- Handover given to on-call team

PLAN:
- Continuous monitoring as per protocol
- Serial observations 4-hourly
- Repeat bloods in 24 hours
- Consultant review tomorrow morning
- Discharge planning when appropriate
